headline: Immigration Officer (287g) at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

positions.description: Assists the Jail Administrator in managing, operating, and controlling all day-to-day activities, security, financial and personnel aspects of the Refugio County Jail. Responsibilities include assisting in operating the direct supervision jail in compliance with local, State and Federal laws, regulations, jail standards and professional correctional practices. Work includes assisting in the planning, organizing, directing and coordinating the security and classification of inmates.
positions.title: Lieutenant / Assistant Jail Administrator

positions.description: Supervise with the daily/nightly operations to include training of staff personnel and inmate supervision at the Refugio County Jail. Maintain order of facility by enforcing all rules and regulations set by local, state and federal statutes.
positions.title: Sergeant of Corrections / Jailer

positions.description: Receive, book and conduct intake process of inmates at the Refugio County Jail. Maintain order of facility by enforcing all rules and regulations set by local, state and federal statutes. Enforcement procedures include arbitrating disputes between inmates, performing disciplinary action and performing inspections. Inspect inmates, their visitors, their mail and the cells as needed for any items that violate the rules of the facility, such as drugs or weapons. Check the facility in its entirety for fire hazards, conditions that do not meet sanitary standards, regulatory infractions and tampering of objects meant to bar entry. Record daily activity logs and give oral or written reports whenever there is a breach of regulations and on the work done by inmates over a period of time.
positions.title: Corrections Officer / Jailer

positions.description: Performed professional administrative, managerial and supervisory activities involving the planning, organizing, budgeting and directing of the Asset Base Management and Housing Quality Inspections Departments.  Key management and administrative position responsible for the leasing, maintenance, operation and management of 1741 conventional low income public housing units.  Assigned as Grievance Hearing Officer, Chief Operations Officer of the CCHA Emergency Response Team and Acting CEO/President in CEO's absence.
positions.title: Sr. Vice President of Asset Management

positions.description: Under the general direction of the Director of Housing Management, performed professional administrative, managerial and supervisory activities involving the planning, organizing and directing of 10 property managers overseeing 14 public housing developments owned and administered by the Corpus Christi Housing Authority.
positions.title: Deputy Director of Housing Management

positions.description: Performed professional administrative, managerial and supervisory activities involving the planning, organizing and directing of the Housing Choice Voucher Program, Housing Choice Voucher Homeownership Program and Housing Quality Inspections.
positions.title: Director of Housing Choice Voucher Program

positions.description: Responsible for the administration, management and supervisory activities involving the planning, organizing, directing and leasing of 168 conventional low  income public housing units; 32 units under the State of California's Department of Housing and Community Development; 5 single family homes under Admin Farm Labor Housing Program and 2 single family homes under Foster Youth Transitional Housing Programs.  Performed the duties of Grievance Hearing Officer.
positions.title: Area Housing Manager

positions.description: Provided specialized case management, employability evaluations and other employability services for parole, probation, domestic violence and mental health clientele eligible to participate in the Welfare-To-Work programs in achieving self-sufficient employment through consultation, guidance and career planning.
positions.title: Employment Training Worker

positions.description: Developed and implemented programs for resident children and adult family members that included after school learning activities, hands-on computer classes, employment guidance and training, resume writing and interviewing techniques.
positions.title: Family Investment Center Coordinator
